Hi John.   Sorry it has taken so long to get back to you.    I have  
found the copy of the letter as well as the book inscribed to Dr  
Compton.   I am still looking for a note that I found in another  
book.   It is some scribbling about a sword that I assume that BW  
Robinson was studying.    If you don't mind, I will look a little  
more for that.   If I don't find it, then I will just send these.    
If you are pressed for time, I can send you these and whenever I run  
across the other again try to find your address and send it.    
CHeers, Bob
On Feb 19, 2009, at 5:11 PM, excelsiorilluminati wrote:

> Hi Bob, may I get photos of the letter and inscription in the book or
> scan? That would be great. If agreeable, please e-mail me at
> excelsiorilluminati@... I will up-date as to the outcome of any
> materials. Thank you, John
>
> --- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "surfson8" <surfson@...> wrote:
> >
> > I have a couple of things from Robinson. One is a copy of his
> book signed with a inscription
> > when he gave it to Dr Compton - very cool, but not much information
> content, just a
> > reference to happy sword collecting. The other is a letter from
> Robinson (who had amazing
> > penmanship) to the owner of a sword that I now own describing at
> length who made the
> > sword, where it was made etc. Let me know if this would be of any
> interest. Cheers, Bob. -
> > -- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "excelsiorilluminati"
> <excelsiorilluminati@> wrote:
> > >
> > > A fellow I know and his kantei group have come upon some
> correspondence
> > > between Messrs. Robinson and Caldwell having to do with their
> > > investigation of nihonto just post war. I have been asked if
> there are
> > > other sources of original (in facsimile) material and
> documentation
> > > that could be made available to supplement these letters. The
> project
> > > is in preliminary stages and any source is not too small at this
> point.
> > > John
> > >
> >
>
>
>
